meanings.definition: The actions, methods, or practices of a warlord.
meanings.sent1: Warlordism can bring chaos and fear to a region.
meanings.sent2: The history books are filled with tales of warlordism in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game pretending to be warlords, showcasing their warlordism.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, cutthroat competition can sometimes resemble warlordism.
meanings.sent5: The movie depicted the brutal reality of warlordism in a war-torn country.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a warlord.
meanings.sent1: The warlordism of the ruler was evident in his iron-fisted rule.
meanings.sent2: The region fell into chaos under the warlordism of the ruthless leader.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show exaggerated the warlordism of the character for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The warlordism of the CEO was compared to a dictator by the employees.
meanings.sent5: The novel vividly described the warlordism of the protagonist, showing his thirst for power.
